website_summaries.verdict: Quality, performance, and a brushless motor place this reciprocating saw in a class of its own.
pros: Brushless motor for heat reduction and consistent power over longer periods
Advanced tech enhances performance and extends life by detecting signs of overload, excessive heat, and discharge
Easy to use Quik-Lok keyless blade clamp
Cuts up to 30% faster w/a variable-speed trigger for precision
cons: An expensive option that's even more so when factoring in the cost of a battery and charger

customer_reviews.title: Blade changing mechanism is "very cheap plastic"  thats a no go!
customer_reviews.text: I love Milwalkee. By far my favorite sawzall but there is one "MAJOR" design flaw. Milwalkee used "plastic" in there blade changing mechanism. BIG NO NO!!! THIS IS A PROBLEM!! I can no longer get the blade in and out of this. It's very difficult and frustrating. Rendering this tool useless. You dont believe me Milwalkee??? Use metal[AKA HEAVY METAL] next time you want something to actually last. Don't disappoint your customers by saying "Nothing but heavy duty". Then they skimp on quality components that go into their heavy duty tools.. Total bs. Very disappointed. Back to the drawing board Milwalkee. #Advice. #Saving people headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Saw
customer_reviews.text: I used this reciprocating saw to cut a 7 inch diameter tree down using a pruning blade. It had plenty of power! As far as vibration goes, this tool has much less vibration then the DEWALT DCS387B (I tried both). The Dewalt was really tiring in that regard. The Milwaukee is on the heavier side, but that is an advantage as the kickback is minimized. The Milwaukee also has an adjustable shoe at the end. This gives you some adjustability on how much blade stroke distance you want. This also lets you vary the blade position to a different and sharper section. Get the larger battery if you plan to do much cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Wis

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Heavy Duty Sawzall
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who uses Milwaukee m18 Fuel tools knows without doubt that this has been the King of cordless Sawzalls for a long time. The only other maker that may have this beat now that I have not tried yet may be Metabo HPT.....their Multivolt model has the orbital feature, this model does not....and I am certain it is just as if not more powerful. Dewalts new "striped of its features" flexvolt does not touch this model.....PERIOD!!!!
customer_reviews.author: A2 Maintenance & Repair

customer_reviews.title: This works faster than my old corded saw.
customer_reviews.text: The M-18 Fuel Sazall is incredible. I'm a senior citizen and I bought this because I didn't want to deal with a chainsaw anymore for cutting down young wild trees on the farm where I live. With a pruning blade, it just blasts through 3" diameter trunks and is just a bit slower for 4 to 6" ones. It seems to cut better than my old corded reciprocating saw. Also made quick work of cutting up some old treated 4x4 posts I wanted to get rid of. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tango Sierra

customer_reviews.title: New trade and DIYer standard.
customer_reviews.text: The corded Milwaukee Sawzall has been the trade industry standard as long as I can remember. It was the go to tool I pulled out first for the toughest jobs from wall demo to cutting big cast iron pipes. With that said, based on my use of the new M18 cordless Fuel Sawzall its clear that it's power, ruggedness, and versatility makes it the new construction saw standard. The raw power of the saw supported by one of the best rechargeable tool battery systems available anywhere make this a must have tool for all tradesman and DIYers period.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: i fall more in love with it
customer_reviews.text: every day i use this sawzall, i fall more in love with it. the only issue i have is that it seems to have issues holding blades sometimes... the blade will literally just pop right out when using some of the thicker blades. kind of frustrating when cutting parts off a car, and the par your cutting is under the vehicle in a place where it's a pain to remove a hot, stuck blade.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: I own 15 acres and my girlfriend who is not really comfortable with chainsaws, uses this (with a 5ah battery) and the Diablo 9"-12" pruning blades to help maintain the land. the power and control-ability are excellent which give her more confidence in doing what needs done. I also use this saw for demolition and cutting any other hard to get at items and am impressed by the power compared to other units i've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Tull

customer_reviews.title: Fast fall
customer_reviews.text: No longer the best. A Hong Kong co. Tool made in China
customer_reviews.author: T.H.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellant Sawzall!! I highly recommend this tool to anyone considering the purchase of a cordless sawzall. It is a well built, rugged tool that screams power. Much more powerful than the competitors and I've owned many sawzalls since I began my plumbing career in 1979. It is not extremely heavy, feels no heavier than other cordless sawzalls I've used. But if you comprimise too much weight, you comprimise durability.
customer_reviews.author: Bam

customer_reviews.title: worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! I wasn't sure how much the fuel components, light, and hook would justify the price difference from the regular version but let me tell you, having the light and hook are HUGE in ways you don't even think of till you utilize them. You can also feel the extra kick of the better components.
customer_reviews.author: 0rion

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 weeks of standard use
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple Milwaukee saws from local stores and they usually last me a year or so since I use them every day. I got this one and it lasted 4 weeks, just long enough to not be able to return it, super unhappy!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph heath

customer_reviews.title: Powerful And heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just like I remember the corded milwaukee beast being like, but I'm not going to lie it's heavy. Lots of power long stroke, cuts fast. Tooless design beats allen wrench any day! For one handed operation it's a bit of a handful, but in the same breath it helps let the saw do the work, I'm not going to complain about the weight in my mind it means its built right, just a warning
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after moderate use
customer_reviews.text: This saw died completely after 2 years and about 10 uses. I'm finished with Milwaukee products.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Last!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best and most powerful sawzall I have used since being a plumber for 23 years now! However, this is my second Milwaukee sawzall of the same model that has died in just 2 months of using,smh! I think I will give Dewalt tools my business from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Payne

customer_reviews.title: The only sawzall you will ever need! Period!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool for my concrete construction company. There is nothing that stands up to the durability, power, and abuse that we have put this though. It may not get used everyday but when it’s used it gets beat up! We have burned up 3 corded sawzalls since 2016 and this one just keeps on going! I would recommend this to anyone from any construction company to even the do it yourselfer. Milwaukee M18 is the only thing I will ever buy!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Do not think twice - Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and a wonderful tool for the price. Everything made by Milwaukee in recent years has been brilliant. Happy I made the purchase from this seller; striking a good balance of price and quality. This unit did NOT come with a battery. I have an armament of Milwaukee Tools, so this was not a problem. If this is you, save yourself the money and use the batteries you have for your drills and other tools. You can ALWAYS source a new battery from this vendor if you have one that goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Power equal to my corded Sawzall
customer_reviews.text: I have the older corded model and still love it but this one is truly amazing. It really does compare with my corded Sawzall and is better in these ways; 1) can be using anywhere - obviously, 2) let go of switch and it stops immediately (no destroyed electrical wires, no scratches on things that don't need cutting), 3) lighter and thus less fatigue using it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Salmon

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase and it uses batteries we already ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for some upcoming DIY projects and my husband has found so many additional uses for it. Very happy with this purchase and it uses batteries we already have. Be mindful, this tool is energy demanding and will drain a fully charged battery quickly. Have a second one ready to go if you have a big job.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come in the original packaging and the guard plate on the front of it has scratches on it like it’s been used and refurbished. Don’t waste your money, buy from a genuine Milwaukee tool dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Bombay

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was best price I found, & delivery was prompt. Given as gift, so unable to say how durable it is, or how long battery life will be. Recipient was very pleased with it. Given four stars, because I am unable to determine how good a product it is myself. It is a very reputable name though.
customer_reviews.author: Lunggislanda.

customer_reviews.title: Its a Milwaukee, nuff said?
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these Milwaukee sawzall model and always get great performance and value. They hold up to production demands and the crew is happier when using high quality tools. No other company makes a more durable, better, operating tool than Milwaukee.
customer_reviews.author: DINO GIBRASKI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sawzall
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Just buy it. Easily worth 150ish bucks. Great quality and power. You won't regret it. I've got a corded makita sawzall that's been my favorite for years beating out all the others Ive used in the meantime and it's finally been replaced by a cordless, with NO sacrifice whatsoever. It's an excellent design. Deserves 6 stars. (Heavy machinery mechanic)
customer_reviews.author: brian ellsion

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this sawzall for a gift. He opened it and tested it and it worked fine. The next time he used it it quit working and now it is after the 30 day return policy. Huge waste of money. Won’t ever buy tools from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Sending back don’t work probably from bouncing around in the box
customer_reviews.author: david ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of buying this product 4 weeks before I used it - Amazon gives a 30 day return policy. I had it on a job this week, being used for 30 minutes, and it broke. This is not a battery issue - batteries are all fully charged. Something is jammed within the mechanism. I took it to the Milwaukee store here in town, to repair. Milwaukee has the best warranty in the business, so I always buy their brand. The bummer here is..... Amazon is not an authorized dealer - so WARRANTY VOID!!!!! - Ya, bummer. I need a saw for my job next week, so will go to Home Depot and spend another $140.
customer_reviews.author: Perrine

customer_reviews.title: Motor bad
customer_reviews.text: Product made a weird noise inside right out of the box. Cut a piece of sheet rock and it started smoking badly. Started my return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price, great saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw arrived in a brown box, not the typical Milwaukee retail packaging, making me wonder if it was a return or perhaps a refurbished product. The saw did appear clean and new and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ferman Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with an Achilles heel.
customer_reviews.text: Love my Milwaukee sawzall operation but take the naysayers advice and cool the hot blades before changing them. Plastic blade-release parts melt and cause downtime if you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient cordless saw!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sawzall so I wouldn’t be tethered to a cord. I have the smaller fuel batteries so I didn’t buy the large capacity battery. I’ll use it for odd jobs around the house and building my deer blind. I used it recently to trim dead branches off my Crab apple tree. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bohunk

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee 2720-20 sawzall
customer_reviews.text: So far, it has been a pleasure to use it. It feels very powerful, and cuts wood with no effort. Mine came from seller Vandalay-supply and arrived new in original package, quick shipping. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Avila Gutierrez.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic reciprocating saw
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on so many projects at home, from removing an old attic stairs, cutting down lots of limbs and small trees and cutting metal. The only problem is that this is so good, I keep on thinking how much extra work I can do cleaning up the woods behind my house.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly V.

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Got this on Amazon for $67 less than HD or any other competitor. First used it with Milwaukee-branded demolition, 9" blades to fell a small tree that had died. Not only did it cut through the tree, I was able to use it later to cut the stump out of the ground. If you're going to be using this "on location," somewhere away from home, make sure to bring a bigger battery than a M18 1.5ah. Bring or buy a M18 5.0, because you'll be doing well to get more than 5-6 minutes of actual cutting out of the smaller M18 batteries.
customer_reviews.author: SheetrockBobby

customer_reviews.title: Best Reciprocating Saw I've used - cordless or corded
customer_reviews.text: Best Reciprocating Saw I've used - cordless or corded. When used with a 5.0Ah Battery, I can get through a whole job and then some before it needs charging again. Fantastic saw - although no surprise since it is a Milwaukee. Hands down best cordless power tools available today.
customer_reviews.author: kkrebs40

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool. Having had milwaulkee tools for 40 years and a corded sawzall for 35, I decided to try the Cordless, and what a good decision it was. This tool is tough, has more than enough power, great new features, and long lasting battery life. I have never regretted buying a milwaulkee tool, keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Garen R. Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: Heavy but built like a tank. Powerful and precise. I made the mistake of buying the new Rigid Recip saw. The piece of junk fell apart the first time I used it. Returned it the same day and got the Milwaukee.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Doctor

customer_reviews.title: A happy work crew is an efficient crew
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to use while remodeling, I can swear that this is just as strong as a corded sawzall. Plus, i think it's more efficient since you don't have to drag an extension cord around with you on the job site. when the crew would show up, everyone would fight for it and I would get stuck with the corded milwaukee. I finally gave in and bought a 2nd one. A happy work crew is an efficient crew.
customer_reviews.author: jessie higa

customer_reviews.title: Best of the
customer_reviews.text: Best Sawzall. I’ve used Dewalt, Rigid, Ryobi and by far this is been the best of them all. Very smooth cut. No need to add pressure to my cuts, because it cuts like butter. Wether I’m cutting wood, wood with nails or ever a palm tree, it does the job like the nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I've cut wood and steel with this, perfect and can handle almost anything if done properly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was worried the saw wouldn't be powerful enough but im pretty sure its as powerful if not more than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow! I have been mulling over getting a cordless sawzall for months. I have been renovating a home and recently returned my fathers corded porter cable tiger saw. I was worried the saw wouldn't be powerful enough but im pretty sure its as powerful if not more than the old tiger saw. 5amp batteries are good enough but i would definitely recommend the 9amp hour.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great as usual. World class manufacturer for pros!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it used and it was/is a fantastic Sawzall. Love the power and blade depth adjustment. Wish the seller had noticed the blade removal slider was broken off though, still changes blades but that 1/4" nub is a pain to get a finger tip on.
customer_reviews.author: hawaii guy

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Give it good blades. I tied the idea of getting a pruning blade and using it to prune larger branches. Great idea. Supper in between tool; did not have to use a hand saw, and I didn't have to crank up the chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: BES

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do home repairs and different projects around the house. Used it twice so far. Once cutting a 55 gal drum to make a stove and the other to cut out a pipe that sprung a leak. It’s powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Billy E Somers

customer_reviews.title: Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars on battery life because it will OBVIOUSLY eat up smaller batteries. Very powerful. Wish I would've bought one a long time ago. I use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Go Broncos

customer_reviews.title: So much power
customer_reviews.text: cuts through branches like butter. Got a while yard trimmed in an hour with only one battery. very durable construction and comfortable rubber over molding. Also way cheaper than Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob barron

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Extremely impressive. I read reviews on how powerful this recip was, but dang it is a beast. I was between this one and Milwaukees hackzall. The hackzall would go in my tool bag a bit better, but you can really get a good two handed grip on this and put your weight down on it if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Biff Tannen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw and battery
customer_reviews.text: Superb saw - may give away my corded one. M18 battery is vastly better than old NiCd. Very pleased with M18 line I have so far (2 drills, circ saw, worklight, and this Sawzall)
customer_reviews.author: Jbb

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my old PC nicad saw. The old one lacked power, this new one cuts like my mak22_: 110v saw. Only drawback is the power increases weight. Small price to pay for the power.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Worthy investment tool.
customer_reviews.text: The saw exceeds expectations. I am using 5ah batteries and the performance is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. Not a single complaint. Don't use it often but it's strong and reliable when I do need it.
customer_reviews.author: MJM

customer_reviews.title: Superb price!
customer_reviews.text: This is from the OEM and the price was unbeatable from every place I looked.
customer_reviews.author: Marley2

customer_reviews.title: Leave those cords behind
customer_reviews.text: The Sawzall M18 system, with no cord to worry about and the same power as corded model, why would you pick anything else.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid, aggressive tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reciprocating saw and the battery life is better than expected. As a bonus, I got some brush pruning blades and the saw does fast work with this chore. Plenty of speed and power.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Black

customer_reviews.title: Saws to the wall
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for cutting trees around the yard, it works great cut an 8” tree down today. Its definitely got some weight to it, it feels sturdy though definitely worth the money. Pitter patter lets get at er
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Ogg

customer_reviews.title: Remanufactured product
customer_reviews.text: Even though this company says brand new ,I really think this is a remanufactured saw did not come in a original box along with a considerably cheaper price .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Product was perfect works great for a good price but the shipping was horrible took forever.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Canatella

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. Cuts through nail embedded wood like a knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. Not too crazy heavy with a battery. Very handy to not have to struggle with an extension cord for a change.
customer_reviews.author: RemcoW

customer_reviews.title: Very rugged
customer_reviews.text: Built well and does tough jobs. Very easy blade change. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Walker

customer_reviews.title: I'm continuing my collection of this great line as needs arise and funds allow
customer_reviews.text: Really lives up to my expectations. I haven't found a Milwaukee 18V FUEL tool yet that has left me wanting. I'm continuing my collection of this great line as needs arise and funds allow.
customer_reviews.author: Pennsylman

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: It worked for 10 minutes and then stopped working. Sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely LOVES this saw. What more can I say!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance
customer_reviews.text: Supper quality and performance as always with Milwaukee. This thing outperforms any corded or battery recip saw on the market. I couldn't be any happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PapaJ

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: It’s a Milwaukee, just a great product, and plenty of power. It came as a bare tool so no battery.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Beast tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a monster when paired with "the axe". Made quick work of all the yard work in 1/2 Battery!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Czuczor

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee Fuel, heavy duty all the way.
customer_reviews.text: When you take it out of the box, the tool feels heavy and ready for everything. Feels that is made to last and great for heavy duty jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Obed Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Saws everything!
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. It's pretty heavy duty, it cuts through mesquite branches like butter. It is such a useful tool inside and outside.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Strong for cordless
customer_reviews.text: More powerful then i thought a corless saw could be. Used to cut up a tree that fell down. Great for all the small branches
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee is the best of the best and this is a great deal. Works well its quiet, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best tool ever. Cut black iron pipes like butter (with proper metal blades)
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Fast cutting and solid
customer_reviews.text: It's a heavy duty saw that cuts fast.....would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Just... Awesome! 😍
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee lives up to it's reputation. Durable, hard working, and for the price you can't beat it. Batteries sold separately but you still save a bunch of moneys by ordering it here.
customer_reviews.author: James Spratt

customer_reviews.title: Works great for trimming trees
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I didn't buy this tool earlier! Works great for trimming trees too
customer_reviews.author: ktmkrt

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Cuts super quickly, very very little tool vibration. Plenty of power. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: That One Guy

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works great everybody else seems to love I have not used it yet !
customer_reviews.author: James Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performs above expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The M18 Fuel Sawzall was the perfect tool that I needed. It performs as expected and is a great addition to my Milwaukee tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sawzall
customer_reviews.text: This is the only sawzall we use. Great price for them.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: What I ordered is what I got and it worked, no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee sells the best stuff and this is just another one
customer_reviews.author: Brian Davolt

customer_reviews.title: Good tool. $70 less than Home Depot!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Bought to replace one that broke, Home Depot wanted $199 for the same tool, and here it was $129!
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Power beyond belief
customer_reviews.text: Bad ass saw!! Milwaukee is the best tools in the industry by far highly recommend to anyone who uses tools on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: LineVoltage

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday, used it quite alot today on the job. Milwaukee tools are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never buy makita again.
customer_reviews.text: Almost too powerful. I would say my only complaint is that it doesn't have a warning letting you know it performs better than a corded sawzall. Seriously, brushless so the batteries last all day or more, it's the most powerful sawzall I've ever used. If you buy this saw be prepared to fight your coworkers trying to borrow it. Makes makita look like trash. Go red tools!
customer_reviews.author: LoveBirds123

customer_reviews.title: The speed that it cuts
customer_reviews.text: Works great ,cuts fast with rough cut blade cut 4×4 in seconds,little heavy though, like how you change blades,would recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Shawn marple

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well built tool. The battery life of the fuel series is awesome. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the trades.
customer_reviews.text: Been using the heck out of this. Love the well built construction and the portability of it.
customer_reviews.author: James Linnenkamp

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I took down a 10ft diameter shrub with this baby. Ate through 2 bars of battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great M18 SAWZALL, perfect for heavy jobs
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this Milwaukee 2720 SAWZALL before I bought my Milwaukee HackZall. The M18 battery and 2720 Sawzall work so much better then the M12 Hackzall. It is like fighting with a fine Japanese Sword (m12 Hackzall) versus a Lightsaber (M18 Sawzall). I used this M18 Sawzall to prune my Pineapple Palm tree, and it made a huge difference. My chainsaw works, but it keeps getting jammed up with fine product from the Palm tree. The Hackzall worked but the M12 was barely enough power to cut through the trunk. The M18 Sawzall cut through it like butter. Great power, nice balance, not to heavy, and the Milwaukee quality. A must buy for cutting around your house.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sayers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this saw. I’ve used it for demo and tree trimming.
customer_reviews.author: frogman55

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy feel. Cut 2x4s like butter. The motor didn't even grunt
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Dont think about it, just buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have had other cordless sawzall and I can tell you without a dought that this is the best Sawzall out there hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S Jestings III

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and well build
customer_reviews.text: The power and speed of the saw worked perfectly for me
customer_reviews.author: Tom Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. This thing is amazing. Lots of power and great battery time
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee rules!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality and power. What else can you expect !! Go red for the finest
customer_reviews.author: Bounds8879

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: BF needed tools for work; he loves it and has had no issues

product_meta.title: Milwaukee 2720-20 M18 SAWZALL Reciprocating (Bare)
product_meta.description: The M18 SAWZALL Reciprocating Saw cuts faster than its corded counterparts and offers up to 2x more run time and 5x longer tool life than competitive saws.The POWERSTATE brushless motor provides cutting power that has only been associated with corded tools. The M18 REDLITHIUM XC4.0 Extended Capacity Battery Pack (not included) delivers up to 2X run time and provides more work per charge and more work over the life of the pack than competitive batteries. The sawzall REDLINK PLUS Intelligence ensures optimized performance and protection from overloading, overheating and over-discharging. The 18-volt lithium-ion SAWZALL features an adjustable shoe, integrated LED light, and a hang hook for convenient storage on the job.
feature_bullets: Delivers faster than corded cutting speed and the durability of a corded saw
POWERSTATE Brushless Motor: Supplies constant power for faster cuts and reduced heat for extended life
REDLINK PLUS Intelligence: Provides optimized performance and overload protection using total system communication between tool, battery and charger
REDLITHIUM XC 4.0 Battery Pack: Provides superior pack construction, more work per charge and more work over the life of the pack than competitive batteries
3,000 SPM Milwaukee reciprocating saw tears through your projects
On-board LED illuminates the cutting space

specifications.Included Components: Power Reciprocating Saw, Specialty Saws, Woodworking
